glsa.title: nfs-utils: Access restriction bypass
glsa.synopsis: An error in nfs-utils allows for bypass of the netgroups restriction.

background.p: nfs-utils contains the client and daemon implementations for the NFS protocol.

description.p: Michele Marcionelli reported that nfs-utils invokes the hosts_ctl() function with the wrong order of arguments, which causes TCP Wrappers to ignore netgroups.

impact.p: A remote attacker could bypass intended access restrictions, i.e. NFS netgroups, and gain access to restricted services.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All nfs-utils users should upgrade to the latest version:
